content.description: 6. Squirmin German Roof 5.11+***  Start on an elevated ledge 10 left a prominent, low, 45 degree roof.  Climb steep juggy rock past 2 bolts to a dihedral/crack and onto the upper slab.  Continue up the crack, then past a bolt (10+) to a rest at the base of the roof.  Pull the 5 foot roof (gear protection) and crank through the exposed, steep rock above: bolted anchors.
content.protection: ~5 bolts plus a single rack of cams to #4 Camalot, bolted anchors, 85 feet.
content.location:
See

Topo & orientation photo - Upper Mighty Mouse Crag.

.

content.description: 5. 1000 Headed Dragon 5.11-***  Start in a short left leaning dihedral 15 left of route #4.  Climb dark rock past a bolt heading towards a left facing dihedral.  Climb the dihedral to tricky sloper moves(bolt) and discontinuous overhanging cracks. Exit right under the overhang to a nice 5.9 face.
content.protection: Recommended gear: #2 Camalot after 1st bolt, small wires after 2nd bolt, various nuts & TCUs (long slings) after 3rd bolt.  ~8 bolts, 95.
content.location:
See

Topo & orientation photo - Upper Mighty Mouse Crag.

.

content.description: 4. Raindance 5.11a**  Start in the dark rock below a left arching dihedral about 45 left of route #3.  Carefully climb up the dark rock (intermittent gear), heading for a bushy ledge 30 high and the start of the dihedral.  Climb the dihedral using traditional gear, pulling the roof at a bolt on the right.  Continue up the spicy slab(5.8) past a bolt and some optional gear.  Finish on a superb fingercrack that ends at a ledge on the right of the summit pillar.
content.protection: A light rack to #2 Camalot, with doubles on TCUs is recommended.  TWO ROPES(or perhaps a 70 M) are needed to reach the ground from the fixed nuts at the ledge. Another option is to climb the very short, but loose finish (5.6 fists) and walk off to the right of the crag (or rappel from anchors shared by routes #1-3).
content.location:
See

Topo & orientation photo - Upper Mighty Mouse Crag.

.

content.description: 3.	Evergreen 5.11a***  This route climbs the left side of the face.  A bolt is visible near a pine tree 15 off the deck.  A hard move past the first bolt leads to more bolts and thoughtful, thin face climbing above.
content.protection: A #2 Camalot on a long sling is recommended at the main break before the headwall(purple metolius TCU or equivalent). ~8 bolts, 80.
content.location:
See

Topo & orientation photo - Upper Mighty Mouse Crag.

.

content.description: 2. High Noon, 5.11c/d ***. Follow a devious weakness past bolts through the main face 15' left of route #1.
content.protection: ~8 bolts, 80'. A small TCU (#0.5 or 0.75 Metolius sizes) is useful after the 3rd bolt as is a #2 Camalot at the large ledge 60' up. Finish the short headwall on routes #1 or #3.
content.location:
See the

Topo & orientation photo - Upper Mighty Mouse Crag.

.

content.description: 1. Private Idaho 5.11a ***  Start behind a dead tree at the base of a dihedral, where a fixed nut is visible from below.  Climb the tricky, light-colored dihedral on mixed gear, traverse below roof to gain the upper black dihedral (crux). Finish up headwall (shallow, small TCU after 1st bolt is recommended to prevent ledge fall).  A challenging mantle can be done after clipping the top anchors.
content.protection: Recommended gear: 0.75 TCU(yellow metolius), #1 Camalot, medium nuts, 0.5 TCU: purple metolius: for headwall). ~7 bolts, 80.
content.location:
See

Topo & orientation photo - Upper Mighty Mouse Crag.

.
